content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Plate Production Line at (-2.0, -76.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill (x=-2.0, y=-76.0) connected to
- Stone furnace (x=-1.0, y=-74.0)
- Burner inserter (x=0.5, y=-74.5) moving items to
- Iron chest (x=1.5, y=-74.5) containing iron plates
- Additional iron chest (x=0.5, y=-72.5) with iron plates

### Copper Plate Production Line at (-21.0, -73.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill (x=-21.0, y=-73.0) mining copper and iron ore
- Iron chest (x=-21.5, y=-74.5) storing copper ore
- Burner inserter (x=-20.5, y=-74.5) moving items to
- Stone furnace (x=-19.0, y=-74.0) with copper plates

### Iron Plate Processing Line at (3.0, -73.0)
Consists of:
- Stone furnace (x=3.0, y=-73.0)
- Stone furnace (x=5.0, y=-73.0)
- Burner inserter (x=6.5, y=-72.5)
- Iron chest (x=7.5, y=-72.5) storing iron plates
- Iron chest (x=3.5, y=-71.5)
- Burner inserter (x=1.5, y=-72.5)

ERROR TIPS

### Fuel Management Issues
- Ensure mining drills have fuel before operation (burner mining drill at x=-2.0, y=-76.0 is out of fuel)
- Monitor fuel levels regularly to maintain continuous operation

### Production Flow Issues
- Multiple furnaces show "no ingredients to smelt" warnings - ensure proper input material flow
- Some furnaces have "furnace result is full" warnings - ensure output is being cleared regularly

### Inserter Configuration
- Verify inserter pickup and drop positions align with intended source and destination entities
- Some inserters are in "waiting for source items" state - check if input materials are available and accessible

### Resource Management
- Several storage chests contain finished products - implement a system to prevent overflow and ensure materials keep flowing
